results.title: Anna Who?
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel and South Australian College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: A film which dispels the myth that Anorexia Nervosa is a slimmers disease affecting only figure conscious women. Five young people (four women and one man) talk frankly about their experience of Anorexia and Bulimia, the factors in the cause and progress of the disease, and the road to recovery.

results.title: Anna [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Anna is the story of a young mother and her mentally handicapped son, Tom. The film traces the path followed by Anna in overcoming her distrust of professional health workers and outsiders. We follow Anna as she searches with increasing confidence, for the extra help that she is told is available to herself and young son Tom.

results.title: Animation: a living art form
results.brief_description: Uses the 1971 motion picture “Shinbone Alley” to show the development of an animated film from the script through the storyboard and animation to the final print. No other credits available.

results.title: Animation in the school classroom
results.creator_credit: Alexander Milsky and Alex Milsky Productions
results.brief_description: A very detailed film showing students and teachers how animation is possible with a minimum of equipment. It gives advice on what paper to use, methods of production, importance of teamwork, advantages of experiment, how to make a light box, how to make an animation table and the requirements of the camera. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.description: A very detailed film showing students and teachers how animation is possible with a minimum of equipment.
